DOC.HEAD: Romanian Embassy Stoned, Splashed With Ink by Protesters
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: About 150 people outraged by the reported massacre of demonstrators in Romania protested outside its embassy here Wednesday, with some hurling stones and bottles of ink before being stopped by police. Police otherwise did not hamper the protesters, who lighted candles in the shape of a cross on the sidewalk outside the embassy, hanged protest posters on its wrought-iron fence and chanted ``Ceausescu Go Away,'' referring to Romanian Communist ruler Nicolae Ceausescu. ``Romania, Rise Up,'' said one poster. A minute-long throwing attack by a handful of protesters left the white embassy walls mottled by black ink. At least one window was broken. The attack ended and the rally proceeded peacefully after a policeman ordered demonstrators to behave themselves. A member of the Polish Socialist Party gave a speech condemning Romania for firing on its people during weekend demonstrations directed against Ceausescu. In another development, the Romanian ambassador was summoned to the Foreign Ministry to hear complaints about ``brutal treatment'' of Polish tourists by Romanian border guards, the state PAP news agency reported. Poland and Romania are Warsaw Pact allies, but relations with the hard-line communist state have been chilly since Solidarity took over the Polish government in August.
